summary: Gene R. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). His name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The documents suggest he was a consistent employee of the committee during this period.
significance: Gene R. Johnson's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, albeit in an administrative or support role as evidenced by the payroll documents.
